description: Stochastic Castro policy for Bank A, with further reduced initial collateral (20% of max capacity) while keeping a strict urgency-based release rule (ticks_to_deadline <= 2) and a conservative liquidity buffer for non-urgent payments. The goal is to cut collateral costs while preserving 100% settlement across stochastic seeds by relying on the urgency rule to eliminate EOD penalties.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: At the start of the day (tick 0), post a reduced fraction (20%) of available collateral as initial liquidity. This trims collateral costs while the payment timing and urgency rules safeguard 100% settlement.

on_true.description: Post initial_liquidity_fraction of max collateral capacity at tick 0 to fund intraday payments.

on_false.description: No collateral changes during the day; rely on the initial posting plus the payment timing rule to manage liquidity while the urgency rule guarantees final settlement.

payment_tree.description: First check if the payment is urgent based on time remaining to its deadline. Urgent payments are always released to avoid any EOD unsettled transactions and associated penalties.

on_true.description: Payment is urgent (ticks_to_deadline <= urgency_threshold). Release regardless of current effective liquidity so it settles before the deadline and cannot incur an EOD penalty.

on_false.description: For non-urgent payments, only release when effective liquidity covers the payment size with a buffer. This reduces the chance of running tight on liquidity later in the day.

on_true.description: There is sufficient effective liquidity with the required buffer (effective_liquidity >= remaining_amount * liquidity_buffer_factor). Release the payment to avoid unnecessary delay while maintaining a liquidity cushion.

on_false.description: Liquidity with buffer is insufficient and the payment is not yet urgent. Hold it to encourage intraday netting and limit liquidity strain; the urgency rule will force release before the deadline.
